meanings.definition: A person who obeys or follows commands.
meanings.sent1: The obeyers listened carefully to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The group of students were good obeyers and always followed the school rules.
meanings.sent3: The little obeyers in the class made sure to raise their hands before speaking.
meanings.sent4: The obeyers in the team were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight's loyal obeyers never questioned his orders.

meanings.definition: Those who comply with rules or orders.
meanings.sent1: The company's obeyers always completed their tasks on time.
meanings.sent2: In a well-functioning society, obeyers help maintain order and harmony.
meanings.sent3: The little obeyers in the family always cleaned up their toys without being asked.
meanings.sent4: The obeyers in the courtroom followed the judge's every word with precision.
meanings.sent5: The captain's crew were the most disciplined obeyers on the entire ship.
